quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Astronauts and Apollo
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, tilda, creatures. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first fly by” for the planet Mars occurred in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1965

questions.question: Which of the three astronauts from Apollo 11 has lost a child in 1962?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: Dinosaurs can be divided into two groups: Ornithschians and Saurischians. The difference between them is mainly in the structure of this part of their bodies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hips

questions.question: The first artificial satellite to orbit Mars orbited the planet for 12 months beginning in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1971

questions.question: Which of the three astronauts from Apollo 11 remained in the command module while the other two separated along with the lunar module?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Collins

questions.question: Which of these waves have the highest wave length?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Radio waves

questions.question: How did Edwin Eugene Buzz Aldrin, Jr. get his nickname Buzz?

options.text: He was given that nickname because he was an engineer.
His sister gave it to him.
He was extremely talkative as a child, to the point of being annoying.
His beloved grandfather called him Buzz.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His sister gave it to him.

questions.question: What is the lightest element that is a metal?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lithium

questions.question: What was the animal featured in the insignia of the Apollo 11 mission, the first mission to land a human being on the Moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An eagle

questions.question: What was the name of the command module of Apollo 11?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbia

questions.question: How much time did the astronauts from Apollo 11 spend on the lunar surface?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2½ hours

questions.question: Who was the President of the United States at the time when Apollo 11 landed on the Moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Nixon

questions.question: Which of these living creatures appearred on Earth first?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fish

questions.question: In math and science a double tilda is often used as  a symbol. Which is symbolized by a double tilde?

options.text: Has the same atomic number as
Has the same first derivative as
Has the same atomic weight as

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Is approximately equal to

questions.question: Which of these objects did the astronauts from Apollo 11 leave on the Moon surface during their mission?

options.text: Two drawings of the Western and Eastern Hemispheres of the Earth
The signature of the American president, and their own signatures

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Body and Procedure
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, genioplasty, process. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Electrooculography is a medical procedure which inspects the potential of which bodily organ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Retina

questions.question: What is transplanted during the medical procedure xenotransplantation?

options.text: Organs from one person to another
Blood from one person to another
Tissues from one species to another

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tissues from one species to another

questions.question: Sigmoidoscopy is a medical examination of which internal organ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Large intestine

questions.question: What body part is involved in the medical procedure called orchiopexy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Testicle

questions.question: Genioplasty or mentoplasty is a cosmetic surgery procedure which aims at improving the appearance of which part of the body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chin

questions.question: Debridement is a medical procedure which is administered in which case?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Tympanoplasty is a type of reconstructive surgery performed on which part of the body?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eardrum

questions.question: The first successful experiment with nuclear fission, the process in which the nucleus of an atom splits into two or more smaller nuclei, was conducted in which year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1938

questions.question: Buzz Aldrin made a guest star appearance in an episode of The Simpsons. What was his comment when Homer Simpson showed no recognition of him being the second man to walk on the Moon?

options.text: Hey, I was just a second late!
Im famous, the rest is history.
How many times have you been on the Moon?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Second comes right after first!

questions.question: On which part of the body is the surgical procedure osteotomy performed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bones

questions.question: These two physicists received the 1951 Nobel Prize for Physics for their pioneering work popularly known as splitting the atom.

options.text: Lise Meitner and Otto Robert Frisch

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Cockroft and Ernest Walton

questions.question: On May 1, 2009, the three astronauts from Apollo 11 were granted this exceptional award.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Congressional Gold Medal

questions.question: Blepharoplasty is a cosmetic surgery procedure which aims at improving the appearance of which body part?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eyelids

questions.question: This is the year in which the worlds first nuclear power plant generating electricity for commercial use was officially connected to the Soviet power grid.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1954

questions.question: Nephrectomy is a surgical removal of which internal organ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kidney

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Constellation and Year
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, leader, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The first Peaceful Nuclear Explosion (PNE) blast in the US was conducted in which year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1961

questions.question: The International Nuclear Events Scale, used to signify the grade of nuclear accidents, has how many levels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a constellation of the Zodiac (the ring of constellations that the sun passes through each year)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Winged Horse

questions.question: What large and obvious summer asterism do Vega, Deneb, and Altair form?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Summer Triangle

questions.question: This 1903 Nobel Prize laureate  discovered radioactivity in 1896.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henri Becquerel

questions.question: Which of the following is the brightest star in the winter night sky of the northern hemisphere?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sirius

questions.question: What are the two twin stars in the constellation Gemini?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Castor  Pollux

questions.question: This place, popular as the center of the Whiskey rebellion, is the worlds first nuclear powered city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania

questions.question: What is the name of the star cluster that is also known as “The Seven Sisters”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pleiades

questions.question: This American physicist was the youngest group leader of the Manhattan Project, a joint effort by the US and their WW II allies to develop the first nuclear weapons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert R. Wilson

questions.question: What is the name of the red supergiant that marks Orions right shoulder?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Betelgeuse

questions.question: What is the constellation Ursa Major commonly known as?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Big Dipper

questions.question: This group of alloys, which is a combination of at least one metal and one or more other elements, is used to clad fuel rods in nuclear plants.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zircaloy

questions.question: What was the codename of the first US thermonuclear bomb test, carried out in 1954?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Castle Romeo

questions.question: The North Star, Polaris, is located within which constellation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ursa Minor

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Pluto and Viruses
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, plutos, reclassification. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: If one were to look at the sky from Plutos surface, every 17 hours they would observe exceptionally beautiful rises of Charon because of its closeness to Pluto.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Viruses are so small that you need a special light microscopе to observe most of them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In virology, what does the term vector refer to?

options.text: An organism that carries a virus but is not infected by it
An organism infected by a virus
A virus that does not parasite on cells but lives independently
A virus that spreads through the air

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An organism that carries a virus but is not infected by it

questions.question: Which of these statements is NOT true about Pluto?

options.text: It is a member of the Kupier belt.
It is the largest object of the Solar Systems asteroid belt.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the largest object of the Solar Systems asteroid belt.

questions.question: Pluto was the ninth planet of the Solar System for 76 years - from its discovery in 1930 until 2006 when it was reclassified as a dwarf planet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is unusual about Plutos three known moons compared to other moons in the Solar System?

options.text: They orbit Pluto at a very high speed.
They are asteroids from another solar system attracted by Pluto and captured by gravitational forces.
They are untypically close to Pluto.
Their orbits are unusually big and elliptical.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are untypically close to Pluto.

questions.question: In what year did 23-year-old American Clyde Tombough discover Pluto, or Planet X, as it was termed then?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1930

questions.question: Although discovered in the United States, Plutos name came from Europe - it was suggested by Falconer Maden, a former librarian at the Oxford University Bodleian Library.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many recognized constellations are there in Earth’s entire view?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 88

questions.question: What feature would Pluto develop if placed as near to the Sun as Earth is?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A comet tail

questions.question: How do viruses reproduce?

options.text: By transforming other cells into viruses
By forcing other cells to produce copies of them

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By forcing other cells to produce copies of them

questions.question: Spectroscopic analysis revealed that Plutos surface is composed mainly of this element.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nitrogen

questions.question: The reclassification of Pluto as a dwarf planet in 2006 caused the emerging of what?

options.text: Risings among astronomy teaches in the USA
New ethnical conflicts in the Middle East
A sect of violent Pluto followers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New word in English

questions.question: Bacteriophages are organisms that have the characteristics of both viruses and bacteria.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which is the wrong statement about the features of Plutos orbit?

options.text: In the long term, it is chaotic.
At certain moments in time, it crosses Neptunes orbit.
It is inclined compared to the plane of other planets orbits.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: At certain moments in time, it crosses Neptunes orbit.

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Viruses and Humans
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, college, ton. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the defense mechanisms against viruses in humans?

options.text: Acid nature of the stomach contents

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The resistance (R) gene

questions.question: Antibiotics are used to treat virus infections in animals and humans but are ineffective in plant virus infections.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Fiberfill is used to make ski jackets. What can be recycled to make enough Fiberfill for one ski jacket?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5 plastic soda bottles

questions.question: Which stage of the virus life-cycle restricts it to infecting only a certain species (or group) of organisms?

options.text: Replication of the viral DNA or RNA

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Attachment to host

questions.question: The first week of June, 2007 was Recycle Now week in  England. Which of these events was featured in its program?

options.text: Building a prison, made of recycled tires.
Beautiful women, parading in bathing suits, made of recycled steel.
Children, demonstrating how to recycle uranium.
Repaving Fleet Street with recycled paper.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Beautiful women, parading in bathing suits, made of recycled steel.

questions.question: In 2002, a college research team built a 42-foot bridge across the Raritan River. What were the beams for the bridge made from?

options.text: Recycled polystyrene cups and milk containers

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Recycled polystyrene cups and milk containers

questions.question: Isao Miyoshi is a very clever recycler from Japan. What did he recycle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dentures

questions.question: When infected by a virus, the bodies of animals and humans start producing a special hormone - interferon. How does interferon help the organism fight virus infections?

options.text: By releasing in the body acids fatal for the viruses
By stimulating it to produce antibodies
By boosting the production of white blood cells
By killing the infected cells and their neighbouring cells

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: By killing the infected cells and their neighbouring cells

questions.question: Which of these companies recycled old sneakers to make tennis courts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nike

questions.question: On January 31, 2008, China announced that it will recycle these to resurface roads.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robbie Williams Cds

questions.question: Which of these is not one of the methods used by viruses to make the host cell release the newly produced viruses?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virosis

questions.question: Mount Rumpke is the highest point and the biggest landfill in Ohio. Its technical name is The Rumpke Sanitary Landfill.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Virus fossils from several thousand years ago show what about the origin of viruses?

options.text: They were once small cells that lived parasitically on bigger ones.
They appeared and evolved simultaneously with life on Earth.
They evolved from bits of DNA that escaped from cells of organisms.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: The boat Earthrace made an attempt to break the record for a circumnavigation of the Earth. It also made voyages to promote the use of bio-fuels. Which of these is one of the substances used to make the bio-diesel, that powers the boat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liposuctioned body fat

questions.question: Approximately how many trees does it  take to make one ton of paper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 17

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Paper and Moon
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, bispo, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Australian pop duo performed the 1990s hit To the Moon and Back?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Savage Garden

questions.question: Approximately how much paper does the average American use in one year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 580 pounds

questions.question: Which song, included on Pink Floyds concept album The Dark Side of the Moon, contains the following lyrics:

options.text: d you run and you run to catch up with the sun, but its sinking
d racing around to come up behind you again
The Great Gig in the Sky

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: In olden days urine was recycled.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Carbon dioxide is a very common pollutant. Approximately how much carbon dioxide is produced by the average American each year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 22 tons

questions.question: Luiz Bispo built a floating house for about $170. How is his house able to float?

options.text: It is made out of recycled cigars and cigarettes.
It is made out of recycled tires.
It recycles carbon dioxide throughout  the house, making it buoyant.
It is made out of recycles plastic bottles.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is made out of recycles plastic bottles.

questions.question: What Academy Award-winning European-born director produced and directed the drama movie Bitter Moon, starring Peter Coyote?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman Polanski

questions.question: What actress won the Academy Award for Best Actress for the portrayal of Loretta Castorini in the romantic comedy Moonstruck?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cher

questions.question: In Mannheim, Germany, people began recycling this.

options.text: Old PCs to make radar equipment  for traffic control
Old swords and knives to make I-beams

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dead pets to make fertilizer

questions.question: The soundtrack for which of these movies does not include the popular song Blue Moon, written by Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bitter Moon

questions.question: In Sussex, England, the Ecopod Company uses recycled paper to make these.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coffins

questions.question: What valley in California is referenced in Jack Londons novel The Valley of the Moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sonoma Valley

questions.question: Name Samuel Coleridges longest poem which contains the lines:

options.text: The Rime of the Ancient Mariner

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rime of the Ancient Mariner

questions.question: Approximately what percentage of Americas waste is paper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 39 %

questions.question: What father-daughter film stars as on-screen father and daughter Moses and Addie in the movie Paper Moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ryan ONeal and Tatum ONeal
